title: Are auditory hallucinations for music somewhat normal? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hearing music when there is no music is not normal. However, having a song ‘stuck in your head’ is normal. And that usually seems like you are hearing the song, as the tune or lyrics run through the mind. But it’s a different sensation than hearing music that isn’t really there. I’ve never heard music that wasn’t there, but I have heard voices. When I hear a song in my head it isn’t loud and doesn’t seem to come from anywhere. It also tends to get stuck on a certain spot and play a certain bit over and over like a broken record. It’s muted and doesn’t interfere with other things I am actually hearing. When I have heard voices, it seems like it came from somewhere in the room. It sounded like it was to the left or right of me, or in another room. In one instance I almost felt the breath of someone whispering to me on my ear. But no one was there. A hallucination tends to make it seem like things are happening outside of yourself, even though it’s all in your head. For the record, I am not schizophrenic, so I can not say what it is like for people who are schizophrenic. I have just had sleep deprivation induced hallucinations, which are very brief and I am fully aware they are not real. At any rate, hallucinations are not normal. And one should see a doctor about it as soon as possible.
